definitions.definition: To hurt or injure (someone) by cutting, piercing, or tearing the skin.
definitions.example: The police officer wounded the suspect during the fight that ensued.
The actor's pride was wounded when the leading role went to his rival.

definitions.definition: Suffering from a wound, especially one acquired in battle from a weapon, such as a gun or a knife.

definitions.example: My wounded pride never recovered from her rejection.

definitions.definition: Of a particle: having undergone an inelastic collision.
